s.text: The mixed results suggest operation in the mode II region with significant individual variability.
We use the Kelvin model as a conceptual representation for describing the individual behavior of both the ligament and the bone as a function of loading rate.

The first study shows mode I at slow strain rate and mode III at fast strain rate.

The major mode of failure was ligament tearing at both of the strain rates.

The number of avulsion is comparable with the number of ligament tears in mode II, where individual variation is the dominant effect.
Mode I applies to the immature group for all strain rates and mode III to mature group for all strain rates.

Ligament tearing occurs more than bony avulsion in mode III that is associated with high strain rates.

At high strain rate, it is generally reported that the ligament tears [ 7 8 9 10 11 12 13 14 15 ] . However, the definitions of a fast or slow rate, and the actual rate range covered in each study, are different.
Neglecting the inertia term for the ligament, a balance of forces requires that the bone stress ? B ( t ) be equal to the ligament stress ? L ( t ) for constant area.
Neglecting the inertia term for the ligament, a balance of forces requires that the bone stress ? B ( t ) be equal to the ligament stress ? L ( t ) for constant area.
Neglecting the inertia term for the ligament, a balance of forces requires that the bone stress ? B ( t ) be equal to the ligament stress ? L ( t ) for constant area.

Stress (MPa), ?, is defined as the intensity of internal force over the unit cross-sectional area of the original specimen [ 1 ] . The definition of strain (% or m/m), ?, is the change in length of the specimen, divided by its initial length [ 1 ] . Strain with percentage units is obtained by multiplying the m/m form by 100.

2 %/sec [ 9 ] . This study showed 60 % ligament tearing in the control group, 44% ligament tearing and 39% bony avulsion with 8 weeks of immobilization, 45 % ligament tearing and 36% bony avulsion from an exercise group, and 65 % ligament tearing from a reconditioning group [ 9 ] .
In exercise, either ? ult, B and ? ult, L is not significantly affected, or they both may increase without significant relative changes.

2 %/sec [ 9 ] . This study showed 60 % ligament tearing in the control group, 44% ligament tearing and 39% bony avulsion with 8 weeks of immobilization, 45 % ligament tearing and 36% bony avulsion from an exercise group, and 65 % ligament tearing from a reconditioning group [ 9 ] .
In exercise, either ? ult, B and ? ult, L is not significantly affected, or they both may increase without significant relative changes.
Therefore, the bony avulsion failure is more common at low strain rates because the bone failure point is reached first.
